page.title: 19LOCAL CUSTOMS.
page.content: The last Pot Fair and Greasy Pole Ceremony was held about 85 years ago. The challenge was to climb the Pole which had been greased with Ham and a Brass Kettle was placed on the top. The challenger had to reach both the Ham and the Kettle. The last known ascender was Adam Holt in 1900. The Pole now standing is not the original, that blew down in a gale. The Pole fell into the Bay Horse Inn and the Brass Cock off the top was found later and given to the Post Office nearby, they lent the original cock to the Church during their centenary celebrations.
